1.title: Pilot
1.plot: A sitcom about three gay friends and their new straight roommate.

2.title: We the People
2.plot: Chaos ensues when the four roommates decide to re-write their apartment constitution.

3.title: Twenty-Somethings
3.plot: The four roommates discover what it means to be true "twenty-somethings" when each confronts his own form of identity crisis.

4.title: Clue Clues
4.plot: A casual game of clue turns into a larger mystery.

5.title: Operation Fat Lady
5.plot: Super sleuth Jonathan spies on his roommates, revealing secrets not even the best private eye could have predicted.

6.title: You Wouldn't Be-Weave It
6.plot: As the four roommates enjoy a trip to the beach, Ethan faces a tough decision that could change their rooming situation for life.

imdb.plot outline: When former roommate Rodney (Edward Mawere) leaves Philadelphia to pursue a budding dance career, loud-and-proud friends Maddie (Stephen Fala), Jonathan (Aaron Palmer), and Alex (Matt McWilliams) find themselves quickly learning to love their new slacker roommate Ethan (Jeff Familetti). with appearances from the "girls across the hall" (Ashley Fisher-Tannenbaum, Ana-Lisa Gunn), failed romantic interests, and Jonathan's mannequin named Manny, the guys spend six episodes of their most intimate moments helping each other get oriented to life as young adults.
imdb.title: One of the Guys
plot: From writer/director Michael Busza, this scripted half-hour web-based television series follows the escapades of three gay friends and their straight roommate as all four seek love, purpose, and a happy home.::Michael Christopher Busza

When former roommate Rodney (Edward Mawere) leaves Philadelphia to pursue a budding dance career, loud-and-proud friends Maddie (Stephen Fala), Jonathan (Aaron Palmer), and Alex (Matt McWilliams) find themselves quickly learning to love their new slacker roommate Ethan (Jeff Familetti). with appearances from the "girls across the hall" (Ashley Fisher-Tannenbaum, Ana-Lisa Gunn), failed romantic interests, and Jonathan's mannequin named Manny, the guys spend six episodes of their most intimate moments helping each other get oriented to life as young adults.::Michael Christopher Busza
